data.text: There shall no evil happen unto him that feareth the Lord;
A wise man hateth not the law;
A man of understanding trusteth in the law;
Prepare what to say, and so thou shalt be heard:
The heart of the foolish is like a cartwheel;
A stallion horse is as a mocking friend,
Why doth one day excel another,
By the knowledge of the Lord they were distinguished:
Some of them hath he made high days, and hallowed them,
And all men are from the ground,
In much knowledge the Lord hath divided them,
Some of them hath he blessed and exalted,
As the clay is in the potterâ€™s hand,
Good is set against evil,
So look upon all the works of the most High;
I awaked up last of all,
Consider that I laboured not for myself only,
Hear me, O ye great men of the people,
Give not thy son and wife, thy brother and friend, power over thee while thou livest,
As long as thou livest and hast breath in thee,
For better it is that thy children should seek to thee,
In all thy works keep to thyself the pre-eminence;
At the time when thou shalt end thy days,
Fodder, a wand, and burdens, are for the ass;
If thou set thy servant to labour, thou shalt find rest:
A yoke and a collar do bow the neck:
Send him to labour, that he be not idle;
Set him to work, as is fit for him:
But be not excessive toward any;
If thou have a servant, let him be unto thee as thyself,
If thou have a servant, entreat him as a brother:
